2024-2025 Shepherd University Catalog

Art Comprehensive, B.F.A.

Print-Friendly Page (opens a new window)
Facebook this Page (opens a new window)
Tweet this Page (opens a new window)

Shepherd University offers a program in art leading to the Bachelor of Fine Arts degree.  The program offers three different concentrations: graphic design, painting, and photography/computer imagery.  

In addition, the department offers a program of study in the teaching field of Art Education (PreK-Adult) for students pursuing the Bachelor of Arts in Secondary Education. Details on the teaching field of Art Education (Pre-K-Adult) can be found under the “Teaching Fields” section of the Catalogue. 

The purpose of the program includes the following:

  1. To expose the students to the significant theories, trends, and principles that structure practices of contemporary art and design. 
  2. To teach students to work conceptually, while mastering the technical skills necessary to fully prepare them for careers in creative fields.
  3. To help students to become visual problem solvers, encourage interdisciplinary collaboration, foster an awareness of professional practices and expectations, and establish opportunities for learning outside the classroom. 

 

Curriculum for a Comprehensive Major in Art (Contemporary)

Total hours required (including free electives), 120 Hours:

Core Curriculum, 42 Hours:

All art majors must takeÂ  ART 103  for their Core Curriculum Tier 2 Arts requirement.

Fine arts core, 27 Hours:

Foundations Core, 9 Hours:
  • ART 140 - Visual Thinking (3cr)
  • ART 150 - Digital Foundations (3cr)


  • Select 3 credits from the following with assistance from your advisor. Courses required in the concentration area cannot be utilized twice.

    • ART 240 - Tools, Craft, and Technique   
    • ART 250 - Sculptural Forms  
    • ART 350 - Media and Concept  
Art history core, 9 Hours:
  • ART 203 - Survey History of Western Art (3 cr)
  • ART 310 - Contemporary Art (3 cr) Â (Satisfies the Core Curriculum Writing in the Major requirement)
  • ART 304 - Special Topics in Art History (3-9 cr) Must earn a total of 3 credits.
Professional practices core, 9 Hours:
  • ART 208 - Professional Practices I (3 cr)
  • ART 390 - Professional Practices II (3 cr)
  • ART 490 - Capstone (3 cr) (Satisfies Core Curriculum Tier 3 Capstone Requirement)

Group I electives, 6 Hours:

Select 6 credits from the following with assistance from your advisor.Â  (Courses required in concentration area cannot be utilized twice.)

  • ART 115 - Drawing I (3 cr)
  • ART 230 - Painting I (3 cr)
  • ART 240 - Tools, Craft, and Technique (3cr)
  • ART 250 - Sculptural Forms (3cr)
  • ART 260 - Printmaking I (3 cr)
  • ART 255 - Digital Illustration I (3 cr)
  • PHOT 281 - Digital Photography (3cr)

Group II electives, 6 Hours:

Select 6 hours from the following with assistance from your advisor. (Courses required in concentration area cannot be utilized twice.)

  • ART 215 - Drawing II (3 cr)
  • ART 330 - Painting II (3 cr)
  • ART 340 - 3-D Digital Fabrication (3cr)
  • ART 361 - Printmaking II (3 cr)
  • ART 400 - Special Topics in Studio Art (3cr)
  • ART 405 - Digital Illustration II (3cr)
  • PHOT 381 - Studio Photography (3 cr)

Concentrations (choose ONE):

In order to progress and to graduate the student enrolled in any B.F.A. concentration must receive a minimum of a C in each course within the concentration, a minimum grade of C in ART 208 - Professional Practices I  and ART 490 - Capstone .

Graphic design concentration, 39 Hours:

Required courses, 30 Hours:
  • ART 115 - Drawing I (3 cr)
  • ART 255 - Digital Illustration I (3 cr)
  • PHOT 281 - Digital Photography (3cr)
  • GRDS 307 - Graphic Design I (3cr)
  • GRDS 312 - Graphic Design II (3 cr)
  • GRDS 317 - Web Interface Design (3 cr)
  • GRDS 412 - Graphic Design III (3 cr)
  • GRDS 422 - Graphic Design Thesis (3cr)
  • GRDS 430 - Advanced Design (3 cr)
  • GRDS 452 - Digital Storytelling (3 cr)
Elective courses, 9 Hours:

Select 9 hours from the following (to be discussed with advisor):

GRDS 400 and 460 are repeatable to a maximum of 6 credits.

  • GRDS 400 - Special Topics in Graphic Design (3 cr)
  • GRDS 460 - Internship in Graphic Design (3-6 cr)
  • ART 340 - 3-D Digital Fabrication (3cr)
  • ART 400 - Special Topics in Studio Art (3cr)
  • ART 403 - Art Criticism (3 cr)
  • ART 405 - Digital Illustration II (3cr)
  • ART 410 - Advanced Drawing (3-6 cr)
  • PHOT 381 - Studio Photography (3 cr)
  • PHOT 389 - Image and Meaning (3 cr)
  • PHOT 420 - Time-Based Media (3 cr)
  • COMM 343 - Graphic Novel (3 cr)
  • OR  COMM 345 - Animation and Communication (3 cr)
  • COMM 406 - Advertising and Imagery (3 cr)
  • BADM 150 - Introduction to Business (3 cr)
  • OR  BADM 311 - Exploring Entrepreneurship (3cr)
  • BADM 340 - Principles of Marketing (3cr)
  • BADM 395 - Consumer Behavior (3 cr)
  • OR  BADM 412 - Strategic Marketing (3cr)
Four-Year Course Progression

Painting concentration, 39 Hours:

Required courses, 33 Hours:
  • ART 115 - Drawing I (3 cr)
  • ART 215 - Drawing II (3 cr)
  • ART 230 - Painting I (3 cr)
  • ART 330 - Painting II (3 cr)
  • ART 403 - Art Criticism (3 cr)
  • ART 410 - Advanced Drawing (3-6 cr) Must earn a total of 3 credits.
  • ART 434 - Advanced Painting Studio (3cr) Must earn a total of 3 credits.
  • ART 434 - Advanced Painting Studio
      (3 cr)
  • ART 435 - Capstone Painting (3cr)
  • ART 475 - Interdisciplinary Studio (3 cr) Must earn a total of 3 credits.
  • ART 475 - Interdisciplinary Studio
      (3 cr) Must earn a total of 3 credits.
Elective courses, 6 Hours:

Select 6 hours from the following (to be discussed with advisor):

  • ART 375 - Research Studio (3-6 cr) Must earn a total of 3 credits.
  • ART 391 - Internship (3-9 cr) May present up to a total of 6 credits.
  • ART 410 - Advanced Drawing (3-6 cr) Must earn a total of 3 credits.
  • ART 476 - Capstone Interdisciplinary Studio (3cr)

Photography/computer imagery concentration, 39 Hours:

Required courses, 24 Hours:
  • PHOT 290 - History of Photography (3 cr)
  • PHOT 281 - Digital Photography (3cr)
  • PHOT 381 - Studio Photography (3 cr)
  • PHOT 385 - Digital Imagery Manipulation (3cr)
  • PHOT 420 - Time-Based Media (3 cr)
  • PHOT 480 - Research in Photography (3 cr) Â  - (Must earn a total of 6cr)
  • PHOT 483 - Alternative Processes (3 cr)
Restricted Concentration Electives, 15 Hours:

Select 15 hours from the following (to be discussed with advisor).Â  No more than 9 credits should be taken in COMM.

  • ART 311 - Art/Photography Practicum (3 cr) (May present up to 6 credits)
  • ART 400 - Special Topics in Studio Art (3cr)
  • ART 403 - Art Criticism (3 cr)
  • ART 475 - Interdisciplinary Studio (3 cr)

  •  

  • COMM 304 - History of Film (3 cr)
  • OR  COMM 404 - Gender and Film (3cr)

  •  

  • COMM 333 - Music Video (3 cr)
  • COMM 346 - Motion Graphics (3 cr)

  •  

  • COMM 350 - Digital Filmmaking (3 cr)
  • OR  COMM 354 - Experimental Video (3 cr)

  •  

  • COMM 403 - Media Studies (3 cr)
  • GRDS 307 - Graphic Design I (3cr)
  • PHOT 400 - Special Topics in Photography/Computer Imagery (3 cr) (May present up to 6 credits)
  • PHOT 486 - Advanced Photography (3cr) (May present up to 6 credits)
  • PHOT 488 - Internship in Photography (3-6 cr) (May present up to 6 credits)
  • PHOT 495 - Advanced Print Portfolio (3cr)
